question: What percentage of surgical randomized controlled trials are discontinued early? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Of these, 21% (81/395) were discontinued early, most commonly owing to poor recruitment (44%, 36/81).
content.source_2: In a registry-based cohort of surgical randomized trials initiated from 2016 to 2022, fewer than one in ten studies were terminated before completion (9%, 18/202), with funding withdrawal rather than poor accrual cited as the predominant reason.
content.source_3: CONCLUSIONS One in five surgical randomised controlled trials are discontinued early, one in three completed trials remain unpublished, and investigators of unpublished studies are frequently not contactable.
content.source_4: Restricting analysis to multicenter randomized trials in complex oncologic surgery, over one third were halted ahead of schedule (35%, 28/80), most following interim efficacy analyses rather than recruitment issues.
